metadata.title: CVE-2019-7572 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
SDL (Simple DirectMedia Layer) through 1.2.15 and 2.x through 2.0.9 has a buffer over-read in IMA_ADPCM_nibble in audio/SDL_wave.c. It was discovered that SDL (Simple DirectMedia Layer) did not properly handle certain crafted input, resulting in a heap-based buffer over-read. An attacker could use this to cause SDL to crash or leak sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-7572` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsdl1.2debian - 1.2.15+dfsg2-5
No subscription required

libsdl2-2.0-0 - 2.0.10+dfsg1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libsdl1.2 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.15+dfsg2-5').
libsdl2 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.10+dfsg1-1ubuntu1').
